title.narrative: Potable Water, Hygiene and Sanitation to Sustainably Fight Against Malnutrition in Preah Vihear Province (HEPAC)

description.narrative: AAH-US will assist the Provincial Department in strategic management of the project, improving its technical skills in project coordination. The organization will sensitize communal councils on issues related to access to water and sanitation, and climate change, and developed a village action plan with representatives from each target village. Additionally, the project will strengthen existing water points (wells and handpumps included) and water and sanitation user communities, and create new ones. The organization will distribute rainwater collection kits, useful in Cambodia’s especially long rainy season, and educate “WaSH Trainers” in each village who will disseminate information on safe hygiene and sanitation practices. The Social Marketing approach will strengthen this behavioural change through creating consumer demand for investment in sanitation and hygiene facilities, such as latrines, and improving access to microfinance. The project aims to make households aware of WaSH issues so that they themselves can initiate change. Action Against Hunger will identify gaps in the supply chain and communicate with manufacturers, increasing market capacity to ensure the sustainability of improved sanitation and hygiene practices.

Making use of a participatory and community-based approach, Action Against Hunger will link the sectors of water, sanitation and hygiene (WaSH), nutrition, gender equality, and food security and livelihoods in an integrated intervention. The organization will contribute to improving the nutritional resilience of the population, with special attention to women and children under 5 years of age, in Preah Vihear province, Cambodia. Specifically, it will improve coverage and quality of water supply and access to improve sanitation facilities and reinforce good hygiene practices in 30 villages in Preah Vihear province, Cambodia.
